parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To strip, divest, renounce. Middle voice from apo and ekduo; to divest wholly oneself, or despoil.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.

word: He made a public spectacle [of them],
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hold up as an example, make a show of, expose. From deigma; to exhibit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (properly: I lead one as my prisoner in a triumphal procession, hence) I lead around, make a show (spectacle) of, cause to triumph.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
